question: [File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/file_format_generator/peephole_optimizer/reducible_pairs.rs] [Function: optimize_window()] [Semantic Correctness] In the StLoc(u) + MoveLoc(v) optimization (line 61), does the pattern correctly verify that local 'u' is truly invalid after MoveLoc, or can this optimization cause use-after-move bugs when the compiler incorrectly assumes the local is dead? (Critical)
